[TITLE]
<line: 25> THE DEFENDANT:

[TABLE]
<line: 27> pleaded guilty to count(s)
<line: 28> 1 and 2 of the Indictment
<line: 29> pleaded guilty to count(s) before a U.S. Magistrate
<line: 30> Judge, which was accepted by the court.
<line: 31> pleaded nolo contendere to count(s) which was
<line: 32> accepted by the court
<line: 33> was found guilty on count(s) after a plea of not guilty

[TEXT]
<line: 35> The defendant is adjudicated guilty of these offenses:
<line: 36> Title & Section / Nature of Offense
<line: 37> 18:1028(A)(a)(1) - Aggravated I.D. Thefts
<line: 38> 18:1542 - Falsification In An Application For A Passport

[TEXT]
<line: 40> Offense Ended
<line: 41> 09/02/2014
<line: 42> 09/02/2014

[TEXT]
<line: 44> Count
<line: 45> 1
<line: 46> 2

[TEXT]
<line: 48> The defendant is sentenced as provided in pages 2 through 7 of this judgment. The sentence is imposed pursuant to the Sentencing
<line: 49> Reform Act of 1984.

[TEXT]
<line: 51> The defendant has been found not guilty on count(s)
<line: 52> Count(s)  is are dismissed on the motion of the United States

[TEXT]
<line: 54> It is ordered that the defendant must notify the United States attorney for this district within 30 days of any change of name,
<line: 55> residence, or mailing address until all fines, restitution, costs, and special assessments imposed by this judgment are fully paid. If
<line: 56> ordered to pay restitution, the defendant must notify the court and United States attorney of material changes in economic
<line: 57> circumstances.

[TITLE]
<line: 59>  July 11, 2017

[TEXT]
<line: 61> Date of Imposition of Judgment

<line: 8> DEFENDANT:   
<line: 9> ERWIN MAZARIEGOS, JR. 
<line: 10> CASE NUMBER:  
<line: 11> 1:16-CR-00160-01 

[TITLE]
<line: 13> IMPRISONMENT 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of:   

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 24 months on count 1 and a term of 3 months on count 2, all to be served consecutively, for an aggregate sentence of 27 months. The 
<line: 18> sentence of 3 months on count 2 shall run concurrent to the unexpired sentence in the Southern District of Ohio Case No. 15CR00007-
<line: 19> 001, and the sentence of 24 months on count 1 shall run consecutive to the 3-month sentence for count 2 and the unexpired sentence in 
<line: 20> the Southern District of Ohio Case No. 15CR00007-001. 

[TEXT]
<line: 22> ܈ The court makes the following recommendations to the Bureau of Prisons: 

[TEXT]
<line: 24> That the defendant be placed at FCI Mendota; 
<line: 25> That the defendant be considered for placement pursuant to the Second Chance Act, as soon as he is eligible and that he further be 
<line: 26> permitted to enroll in college courses as soon as he is eligible.   

[TEXT]
<line: 28> ܈ The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal. 
<line: 29> ܆ The defendant shall surrender to the United States Marshal for this district: 

[TEXT]
<line: 31> ܆ 
<line: 32> The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons: 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> ܆ 
<line: 35> before 2 p.m. on                                                                
<line: 36> ܆ 
<line: 37> as notified by the United States Marshal. 
<line: 38> ܆ 
<line: 39> as notified by the Probation or Pretrial Services Office. 

[TITLE]
<line: 41> RETURN 

[TEXT]
<line: 43> I have executed this judgment as follows: 

[TEXT]
<line: 45> Defendant delivered on                                             to                                                        

[TEXT]
<line: 47> at                                                             , with a certified copy of this judgment. 

[TITLE]

[TEXT]

[TITLE]
<line: 13> SUPERVISED RELEASE 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 3 years. This term consists of 1 year on 
<line: 16> count 1 and a term of 3 years on count 2, all such terms to run concurrently. 

[TITLE]
<line: 18> MANDATORY CONDITIONS 

[TEXT]
<line: 20> 1. 
<line: 21> You must not commit another federal, state or local crime. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> 2. 
<line: 24> You must not unlawfully possess a controlled substance. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 3. 
<line: 27> You must refrain from any unlawful use of a controlled substance. You must submit to one drug test within 15 days of 
<line: 28> release from imprisonment and at least two periodic drug tests thereafter, as determined by the court. 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> ܆ The above drug testing condition is suspended, based on the court's determination that you 
<line: 31> pose a low risk of future substance abuse. (check if applicable) 
<line: 32> 4. ܆ 
<line: 33> You must cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer. (check if applicable) 

[TEXT]
<line: 35> 5. ܆ 
<line: 36> You must comply with the requirements of the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (42 U.S.C. § 16901, et 
<line: 37> seq.) 
<line: 38> 
<line: 39> as directed by the probation officer, the Bureau of Prisons, or any state sex offender registration agency in which you 
<line: 40> 
<line: 41> reside, work,are a student, or were convicted of a qualifying offense. (check if applicable) 
<line: 42> 6. ܆ You must participate in an approved program for domestic violence. (check if applicable) 

[TEXT]
<line: 44> You must comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this court as well as with any other conditions on the 
<line: 45> attached page. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case: 1:16-cr-00160-SL  Doc #: 29  Filed:  07/11/17  4 of 7.  PageID #: 147

[ABANDON]
<line: 4> AO 245B (Rev. 11/16) Judgment in a Criminal Case 

[ABANDON]
<line: 6> Judgment -- Page 4 of 7 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> DEFENDANT:   
<line: 9> ERWIN MAZARIEGOS, JR. 
<line: 10> CASE NUMBER:  
<line: 11> 1:16-CR-00160-01 

[TITLE]
<line: 13> STANDARD CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> As part of your supervised release, you must comply with the following standard conditions of supervision. These conditions are 
<line: 16> imposed because they establish the basic expectations for your behavior while on supervision and identify the minimum tools needed 
<line: 17> by probation officers to keep informed, report to the court about, and bring about improvements in your conduct and condition. 

[TEXT]
<line: 19> 1. You must report to the probation office in the federal judicial district where you are authorized to reside within 72 hours of your 
<line: 20> release from imprisonment, unless the probation officer instructs you to report to a different probation office or within a different time 
<line: 21> frame. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> 2. After initially reporting to the probation office, you will receive instructions from the court or the probation officer about how and 
<line: 24> when you must report to the probation officer, and you must report to the probation officer as instructed. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 3. You must not knowingly leave the federal judicial district where you are authorized to reside without first getting permission from 
<line: 27> the court or the probation officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 29> 4. You must answer truthfully the questions asked by your probation officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 31> 5. You must live at a place approved by the probation officer. If you plan to change where you live or anything about your living 
<line: 32> arrangements (such as the people you live with), you must notify the probation officer at least 10 days before the change. If notifying 
<line: 33> the probation officer in advance is not possible due to unanticipated circumstances, you must notify the probation officer within 72 
<line: 34> hours of becoming aware of a change or expected change. 

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 6. You must allow the probation officer to visit you at any time at your home or elsewhere, and you must permit the probation officer 
<line: 37> to take any items prohibited by the conditions of your supervision that he or she observes in plain view. 

[TEXT]
<line: 39> 7. You must work full time (at least 30 hours per week) at a lawful type of employment, unless the probation officer excuses you from 
<line: 40> doing so. If you do not have full-time employment you must try to find full-time employment, unless the probation officer excuses 
<line: 41> you from doing so. If you plan to change where you work or anything about your work (such as your position or your job 
<line: 42> responsibilities), you must notify the probation officer at least 10 days before the change. If notifying the probation officer at least 10 
<line: 43> days in advance is not possible due to unanticipated circumstances, you must notify the probation officer within 72 hours of 
<line: 44> becoming aware of a change or expected change.  If not in compliance with the condition of supervision requiring full-time 
<line: 45> occupation, you may be directed to perform up to 20 hours of community service per week until employed, as approved or directed by 
<line: 46> the pretrial services and probation officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 48> 8. You must not communicate or interact with someone you know is engaged in criminal activity. If you know someone has been 
<line: 49> convicted of a felony, you must not knowingly communicate or interact with that person without first getting the permission of the 
<line: 50> probation officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 52> 9. If you are arrested or questioned by a law enforcement officer, you must notify the probation officer within 72 hours. 
<line: 53> 10. You must not own, possess, or have access to a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or dangerous weapon (i.e., anything that 

[TEXT]
<line: 55> was designed, or was modified for, the specific purpose of causing bodily injury or death to another person such as nunchakus or 
<line: 56> tasers). 
<line: 57> 11. You must not act or make any agreement with a law enforcement agency to act as a confidential human source or informant 

[TEXT]
<line: 59> without first getting the permission of the court. 
<line: 60> 12. If the probation officer determines that you pose a risk to another person (including an organization), the probation officer may 

[TEXT]
<line: 62> require you to notify the person about the risk and you must comply with that instruction. The probation officer may contact the 
<line: 63> person and confirm that you have notified the person about the risk. 

[TEXT]
<line: 65> 13. You must follow the instructions of the probation officer related to the conditions of supervision. 

[TITLE]
<line: 67> U.S. Probation Office Use Only 

[TEXT]
<line: 69> A U.S. probation officer has instructed me on the conditions specified by the court and has provided me with a 
<line: 70> written copy of this judgment containing these conditions. I understand additional information regarding these 
<line: 71> conditions is available at the www.uscourts.gov. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case: 1:16-cr-00160-SL  Doc #: 29  Filed:  07/11/17  5 of 7.  PageID #: 148

[TEXT]
<line: 8> DEFENDANT:   
<line: 9> ERWIN MAZARIEGOS, JR. 
<line: 10> CASE NUMBER:  
<line: 11> 1:16-CR-00160-01 

[TITLE]
<line: 13> SPECIAL CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION 

[TITLE]
<line: 15> Financial Disclosure 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> You must provide the probation officer with access to any requested financial information and authorize the release of any financial 
<line: 18> information. The probation office may share financial information with the U.S. Attorney's Office. 

[TITLE]
<line: 20> No New Debt/Credit 

[TEXT]
<line: 22> You must not incur new credit charges or open additional lines of credit without the approval of the probation officer. 

[TITLE]
<line: 24> Substance Abuse Treatment and Testing 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> The defendant shall participate in an approved program of substance abuse testing and/or outpatient or inpatient substance abuse 
<line: 27> treatment as directed by their supervising officer; and abide by the rules of the treatment program. The probation officer will supervise 
<line: 28> your participation in the program (provider, location, modality, duration, intensity, etc.). The defendant shall not obstruct or attempt to 
<line: 29> obstruct or tamper, in any fashion, with the efficiency and accuracy of any prohibited substance testing. 

[TITLE]
<line: 31> Search / Seizure 

[TEXT]
<line: 33> You must submit your person, property, house, residence, vehicle, papers, computers (as defined in 18 U.S.C. § 1030(e)(1)), other 
<line: 34> electronic communications or data storage devices or media, or office, to a search conducted by a United States probation officer. 
<line: 35> Failure to submit to a search may be grounds for revocation of release. You must warn any other occupants that the premises may be 
<line: 36> subject to searches pursuant to this condition. 

[TEXT]
<line: 38> The probation officer may conduct a search under this condition only when reasonable suspicion exists that you have violated a 
<line: 39> condition of supervision and that the areas to be searched contain evidence of this violation. Any search must be conducted at a 
<line: 40> reasonable time and in a reasonable manner. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case: 1:16-cr-00160-SL Doc #: 29 Filed: 07/11/17 6 of 7. PagelD #: 149

[ABANDON]

<line: 11> 1:16-CR-00160-01

[TITLE]
<line: 13> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES

[TEXT]
<line: 15> The defendant must pay the total criminal monetary penalties under the schedule of payments on Sheet 6..

[TABLE]
<line: 17> JVTA Assesment*
<line: 18> Fine
<line: 19> Restitution
<line: 20> Assessment
<line: 21>  TOTALS
<line: 22> $200.00
<line: 23> $.00
<line: 24> $.00

[TEXT]
<line: 26> The determination of restitution is deferred until.
<line: 27> An Amended Judgment in a Criminal Case (AO245C) will be entered
<line: 28> after such determination.
<line: 29> The defendant must make restitution (including community restitution) to the following payees in the amount listed below..

[TEXT]
<line: 31> If the defendant makes a partial payment, each payee shall receive an approximately proportioned payment. However, pursuant to 18 U.S.C..
<line: 32> s 3664(i), all nonfederal victims must be paid before the United States is paid.

[TEXT]
<line: 34>  Restitution amount ordered pursuant to plea agreement $

[TEXT]
<line: 36> The defendant must pay interest on restitution and a fine of more than $2,500, unless the restitution or fine is paid in full before.
<line: 37> the fifteenth day after the date of the judgment, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. $ 3612(f). All of the payment options on Sheet 6 may be.
<line: 38> subject to penalties for delinquency and default, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. s 3612(g)

[ABANDON]

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]
<line: 42> The court determined that the defendant does not have the ability to pay interest and it is ordered that:

[TEXT]
<line: 44> the interest requirement is waived for the
<line: 45>  fine
<line: 46> the interest requirement for the
<line: 47> 0
<line: 48>  fine

[TEXT]
<line: 50> restitution.
<line: 51> restitution is modified as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 53> * Justice for Victims of Trafficking Act of 2015, Pub. L. No. 114-22
<line: 54> ** Findings for the total amount of losses are required under Chapters 109A, 110, 110A, and 113A of Title 18 for offenses committed on or after
<line: 55> September 13, 1994, but before April 23, 1996.

[TITLE]
<line: 57> Fine

[TEXT]
<line: 59> Based on a review of the defendant's financial condition as set forth in the presentence report, the Court finds that the defendant does
<line: 60> not have the ability to pay a fine. The Court waives the fine in this case.

[TITLE]
<line: 62> Special Assessment

[TEXT]
<line: 64> You must pay to the United States a special assessment of $200, which is due immediately

[TITLE]
<line: 66> Restitution

[TEXT]
<line: 68> Restitution is not an issue in this case.

<line: 13> SCHEDULE OF PAYMENTS 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> Having assessed the defendant’s ability to pay, payment of the total criminal monetary penalties is due as follows: 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> A 
<line: 18> ܆

<line: 23> ܆

<line: 25> ܆

<line: 27> ܆

<line: 31> ܆

<line: 36> ܆

<line: 38> ܆

<line: 40> ܆

<line: 42> C 
<line: 43> ܆ 
<line: 44> Payment in equal                       (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of $                          over a period of 
<line: 45>                               (e.g., months or years), to commence                    (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after the date of this judgment; 
<line: 46> or 
<line: 47> D 
<line: 48> ܆ 
<line: 49> Payment in equal 20 (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of $                          over a period of 
<line: 50>                               (e.g., months or years), to commence                    (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release from 
<line: 51> imprisonment to a term of supervision; or 
<line: 52> E 
<line: 53> ܆ 
<line: 54> Payment during the term of supervised release will commence within                        (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release 
<line: 55> from imprisonment. The court will set the payment plan based on an assessment of the defendant’s ability to pay at that 
<line: 56> time; or 
<line: 57> F 
<line: 58> ܈ 
<line: 59> Special instructions regarding the payment of criminal monetary penalties: 
<line: 60> It is ordered that the Defendant shall pay to the United States a special assessment of $200.00 for Counts 1 and 2 
<line: 61> which shall be due immediately.  Said special assessment shall be paid to the Clerk, U.S. District Court. 

[TEXT]
<line: 63> Unless the court has expressly ordered otherwise, if this judgment imposes imprisonment, payment of criminal monetary penalties is 
<line: 64> due during imprisonment.  All criminal monetary penalties, except those payments made through the Federal Bureau of Prisons’ 
<line: 65> Inmate Financial Responsibility Program, are made to the clerk of the court. 

[TEXT]
<line: 67> The defendant shall receive credit for all payments previously made toward any criminal monetary penalties imposed. 

[TEXT]
<line: 69>  Joint and Several 
<line: 70> See above for Defendant and Co-Defendant Names and Case Numbers (including defendant number), Total Amount, Joint and 
<line: 71> Several Amount, and corresponding payee, if appropriate. 

[TEXT]
<line: 73> ܆ Defendant shall receive credit on his restitution obligation for recovery from other defendants who contributed to the same 
<line: 74> loss that gave rise to defendant's restitution obligation. 
<line: 75> ܆ 
<line: 76> The defendant shall pay the cost of prosecution. 
<line: 77> ܆ 
<line: 78> The defendant shall pay the following court cost(s):                                                      
<line: 79> ܆ 
<line: 80> The defendant shall forfeit the defendant’s interest in the following property to the United States: 

[TEXT]
<line: 82> Payments shall be applied in the following order: (1) assessment, (2) restitution principal, (3) restitution interest, (4) fine principal, 
<line: 83> (5) fine interest, (6) community restitution, (7) JVTA Assessment, (8) penalties, and (9) costs, including cost of prosecution and court costs.
